meanings.sent1: I made a mistake in my math homework, so I had to retallying the numbers.
meanings.sent2: She always double-checks her work by retallying the totals.
meanings.sent3: After retallying the votes, the student council election results remained the same.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to retallying the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: Retallying the ingredients in the recipe ensured a delicious cake.

meanings.definition: The act of counting or calculating again.
meanings.sent1: The retallying of the votes revealed a tie between the two candidates.
meanings.sent2: The retallying of the inventory showed a discrepancy in the numbers.
meanings.sent3: The retallying of the money in the cash register was necessary after the error was discovered.
meanings.sent4: The retallying of the scores led to a change in the final rankings.
meanings.sent5: The retallying of the votes was crucial to ensure accuracy in the election results.
